meanings.definition: Speaking or using only one language.
meanings.sent1: She is a monolingual student who only speaks English.
meanings.sent2: The monolingual child struggled to communicate with the Spanish-speaking teacher.
meanings.sent3: The monolingual parrot only knew how to say 'hello' in English.
meanings.sent4: In a world of diverse languages, being monolingual can sometimes feel limiting.
meanings.sent5: The monolingual sign at the museum reminded visitors to keep quiet.

meanings.definition: A person who speaks only one language.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a monolingual and finds it challenging to learn new languages.
meanings.sent2: The monolingual struggled to order food in the foreign restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The monolingual was surprised when they traveled abroad and couldn't understand anyone.
meanings.sent4: Being a monolingual in a multicultural society can sometimes lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The monolingual's language skills were put to the test during the international conference.
